intro: Ginoria buchii, commonly known as the golden bell heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ginoria buchii is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
